website_summaries.verdict: The R6300 is quite a beast of a router, and it certainly gives a promise of things to come. While we score it highly, we'd hold off on purchasing anything 802.11ac until client chips are more widespread — by then, there'll likely be something even better around.
pros: Can set up via mobile devices
cons: Although they should be along soon, no 802.11ac wireless adapters are available yet to take advantage of it
Mobile app needs a lot of finessing
Netgear's router UI still needs work

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this router for 4 years. Never had a problem with it. This router is capable of cable of covering a house that is approximately 2200 square feet. It has been very reliable and very fast. Currently, there is a Roku, Amazon Fire Stick, and a Google Chromecast hooked up to it. None of them have any problems streaming using this router. There is also quite a few iDevices switches: , installed that are also connected to this router. Everything has been working fine.
customer_reviews.author: RPLTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: Sleek looking router
customer_reviews.text: Have only had this a couple weeks. My understanding is there is a newer one out but I wanted this one because with the Genie software I can schedule the wifi to go on and off so the kids aren't online all during the night. So far it works like a charm and looks really nice! If you buy one, remember to check the time zone. Without realizing it, mine was for another zone and my schedule was then off until tech support guided me to change it. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Bought this almost 4 years ago. Within the first year or so, had to get it replaced. Luckily it was still under warranty. Now, less than 2 years since the replacement, the current unit is not working. It will connect for a bit, then stop. We reset it, it works, then stops again. At this rate, it is cheaper to rent a router from Comcast. I would recommend another brand or model.
customer_reviews.author: bren

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty disappointed. Spending this much on a router shouldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disappointed. Spending this much on a router shouldn't mean that it needs to be rebooted every few days. I've got a couple IP cams, DirecTV boxes and a few computers and phones. It's not like this happens when I'm streaming or downloading huge files, the internet connection just drops off randomly when I'm not at home so my wife can freak out about Instagram. I'm on the latest firmware with all basic settings and I just can't get this thing to work like it should. My budget for high end routers is out until 2015.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Soler

customer_reviews.title: Slow, short ranged and just plain complicated.
customer_reviews.text: 09/2014 Update: I finally got it too work after many online blogging and searching. But damn it still doesn't deliver the speeds it advertises. This device is slow for what you pay. Find something else I'm done with net-gear crap. No antennas means no long range and that is also true. My kitchen isn't even 30 ft away and this s*** can't even deliver. I'm done with this I will give it to my little friend. I Have tried so many other routers and I haven't found the perfect one yet. If you know of one let me know please! I'm desperate!
customer_reviews.author: Master Luis

customer_reviews.title: WARNING DO NOT PLUG YOUR HARD DRIVE INTO THIS ROUTER.
customer_reviews.text: I'd have given his router 5 Stars, except the fact I plugged a hard drive into the router to see if I could connect wirelessly. I could, but it reconfigured my file structure and now I can only access my drobo hard drive through the router. File permissions were changed, and I spent 4 months negotiating in circles with IT and another 4 months carefully, meticulously, tediously transferring 16 Terabytes of data to another hard drive. That one small mistake cost me weeks and weeks of time as well as $1400 for a new drobo and hard drives to transfer the files to. WARNING DO NOT PLUG YOUR HARD DRIVE INTO THIS ROUTER.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Philipson

customer_reviews.title: It died after 6 months, the warranty replacement was DOA, and the second warranty replacement is on its last leg.
customer_reviews.text: The R6300 worked great for six months; however, it died - connection drops, low signal, then wireless failure. It took Netgear three weeks to send us a warranty replacement; however, the warranty replacement was dead on arrival. We could even hear a loose part rattling around on the inside of the replacement router. Netgear sent us a second replacement, the R6300v2. It seemed to work just fine too; however, it only lasted 1 month before it started having connection issues, unstable connections, and signal dropout. We will no longer buy Netgear products.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Tried the rest, this is the best!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several different high-end routers and had to return them. I have owned this now for 6 months and it works great. I've rebooted it approximately 5 times (for reasons unrelated to Netgear s/w or h/w). Plugged my 3TB Hitachi into the USB and share media effortlessly with whomever I wish to share. My computer is close and I connect on the 5Ghz band whist the rest of the fam connects on the 2.4Ghz band. All of our connections are stable and connect at good speeds. One gets 50Mbs a second while the others are connect via powerline adapters (love those things). Lots of other devices and game systems have flawless connections as well.
customer_reviews.author: Huntclan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the Money- Bad Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: This router has been trouble from day 1! I should have returned it right away once I saw that it didn't work with our desktop. I have contacted customer service at Netgear numerous times to no avail. I got a replacement of the exact model router and it still doesn't work to my expectations. The wireless is fine but the wired connection to our desktop is abysmal.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great technical support!
customer_reviews.text: Although I purchased this router as a gift, I’m writing because we found Netgear’s Customer Support (855-432-7432) outstanding when assistance was needed to install an updated version of their firmware on the router. Their computer wasn’t allowing the update but the tech was extremely patient, knowledgeable and didn’t give up until he got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I like this router. However, we had one die on us (the power just stopped working) and the customer service is a nightmare! They were trying to get us to purchase some type of 'protection' because they said that this router was hacked and we needed to purchase an OUTRAGEOUS protection plan to the tune of $400 for 6 months!!! I was under the impression that I was using the most sophisticated security available at this time. Not happy at all. Hope another company comes out with a fast router. Can't wait to dump NETGEAR!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberle

customer_reviews.title: replaced a Linksys; life is tolerable again
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of intermittent network failures with a 3-month-old Linksys mid-line 802.11n router. When a Comcast technician came by to poke around he looked at the Linksys and said "You should throw that out. Linksys never works." I took his advice and replaced it with this Netgear and all of the problems went away. That's the second time that I have solved an annoying networking problem by throwing away a Linksys and replacing with Netgear. The one thing that hasn't worked with this Netgear is having an Ooma VoIP box behind it, even giving the Ooma the highest priority QoS. So the network is configured with cable modem -> Ooma -> Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Greenspun

customer_reviews.title: Does not maintain connection
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this router because it had good recommendations from CNET and when it works it is very good. Unfortunately it will not hold a connection well and drops connections. Two months of messages with tech support has not been able to solve the issue. replacement model has the same problems. Good speed on both bands when the connection holds. Look around for more reliable models.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my internet and wi-fi the support is great setup is easy ahead of others they offered 5g functionality when it was far off its future proof i love there products 😊
customer_reviews.author: cosmicpower

customer_reviews.title: I'm Liking This
customer_reviews.text: This router is easy to set-up. This is the first time I didn't have to call support to help set-up a router. Everything pops up on the computer wirelessly and all you have to do is follow the prompts, this includes setting up a secured network. Didn't even need to hook up a computer to it. I'm running Comcast at 25 mbps and Windows 8. I run Amazon Instant Stream,VUDU, ROKU, and a Sony Blu-ray with media streaming. I'm not having any problems. A friend in the computer business says that it has enough advanced features to future proof my wireless network for a while. I would recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: L. English

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and haven't put it up to testing with the dozens of devices simultaneously used by my kids yet, but with with seven devices it is working really well. I am getting the full bandwidth of download speeds, and about 30% faster uploads and no lags. We typically have multiple people streaming movies and gaming. My friend works for a DSL company, and he recommended getting a better router to get the most out of what I currently have (12mps) instead of upgrading the connection speeds. I glad I listened. This will pay itself off in only a few months of not having to pay extra. Easy setup took less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: I am still working with this router it has a ...
customer_reviews.text: I am still working with this router it has a little further range than my linksys g router but was expecting more range , what bothers me more is that the actual official NETGEAR website is not available they put you on hold indefinetly , and it was interesting to see that the NETGEAR sub sites tend to play off the customers that have issues, be careful because they want to access your computer, such as the NETGEAR website in Chicago , which is not a certified website, which states they want to help you with your issues, which other sites will do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Beyous

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: This product did everything it said it would do and more. It was very easy to set up. I love the dual band. We live in Florida and have a lot of guests visit. Everyone has computers, tablets, smartphones. Everyone is hitting the wireless at once. It handles multiple guests at once. We have a 3800 sq. ft. condo. and a deck. Wherever you are in the condo or on the deck, wireless is available, I would highly recommend this product! The printer can also be set up wirelessly through the router. The wireless was broken on my printer so I hooked the printer up through the router. It works wonderfully for everyone. Now everyone can print wirelessly also.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Smith

customer_reviews.title: setup easy - worked first time
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a breeze using my Windows 7 desktop home computer. This has greatly improved my signal reception throughout my 3 story home, with greatly increased throughput. So far, no glitches - video streaming is now flawless. In addition to setting up the 6300 (1750) router I first set up a Netgear 1450 that I purchased at Costco. For that router I used an older laptop computer running Windows Vista. There was much trial and error with that installation, but I suspect that it was the older computer and not a fault of the Netgear 1450. For my next installation I will be using the newer Windows 7 computer, and I expect it will be easy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F.

customer_reviews.title: This Router sucks... NETGEAR Support sucks...
customer_reviews.text: This router started acting up within days of my Amazon 'return' period expiring. As a result, I was forced to deal with NETGEARS archaic and sub-par customer service department. Needless to say after multiple e-mails and 'canned responses' they did not fix the problem, nor would they offer to send me a replacement unit. I will NEVER buy another NETGEAR product, and I am also removing all of the NETGEAR routers and products from my 2nd home, and my entire 250+ computer business. NETGEAR SUCKS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nick W.

customer_reviews.title: Range issue
customer_reviews.text: I really don't see any upgrade in performance from the old wireless G Linksys I was using. Certainly, range is decreased, as I was able to get good signal in my garage (from 2nd floor router). Now, access in garage and outside home is spotty at best, and typically not useable. I changed the channel a couple of times on the Netgear unit, but it doesn't make a difference in usable range. I wouldn't recommend this router if range is one of your purchasing factors.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Let's just say that I didn't consider Netgear when I replaced this unit. I had had lots of trouble with it, and then the 5ghz band failed and couldn't be fixed. Support is nonexistent after 90 days.
customer_reviews.author: TheEE

customer_reviews.title: expensive but worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a beautiful ASUS Black Diamond Dual-Band Wireless-N 600 Router (RT-N56U) that began to overheat (inside a month) with the Netgear. It is expensive but 3 months in, I have yet to reboot. That is unheard of in this house. We have 4 Rokus, 2 PC gaming machines, one chrome box, VIOP phone, 2 tablets and cell phones on WiFi. There are no less that 11 items connected at all times. This thing is a rock. I am/was a dlink person.. I will buy Netgear from this point forward. If you can afford it, this is a definite buy. UPDATE 2 1/2 months in.. not a single reboot needed LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: BJF

customer_reviews.title: Good router overall
customer_reviews.text: No complaints about browsing speeds, etc. Router definitely does the job in that department. However, like any top-of-the-line piece of computer equipment, this model seemed to come with some glitches. If there is an interruption in power or if you suddenly unplug the unit, it may stop functioning, and you'll have to go through a somewhat arduous process to download new firmware onto the unit. Maybe by now Netgear has ironed this issue out, but better safe than sorry. Plug it into a battery backup power strip and use the on/off button (instead of simply unplugging the unit) to avoid needless power interruptions and possible headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Escobar

customer_reviews.title: A Superfast Router set up for the Future of Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: I have a few devices that can take advantage of the 802.11 ac, backwards compatible for the 802.11 n devices, but the router sure makes a difference when it does use the wider band. My MacBook Pro detects the router and I've tested download speeds of 60.1Mbps and 6.9 Mbps upload. There is a difference. The NetGear Genie App is as simple as can be, no difficulties with set up at all. And having a dashboard to look at all the connections is really cool, and also let's you know all other functions of the router. I don't regret spending to this category.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Condon

customer_reviews.title: So glad is spent the extra and got this!
customer_reviews.text: My old N router died and we were suddenly without a way to connect two laptops, two tablets, and two smartphones. In our technology tethered world, this is enough to cause withdrawal symptoms to appear. I decided to spend extra and get the new AC wireless and I am very happy that I did. Not only was it easy to setup, but my network signal is much stronger throughout the house, and we don't have any dead spots anymore. I also am getting between 30 and 40 Mbps wirelessly, while my desktop computer gets between 60 and 70. My wireless connection is much faster with this new router. I do love it!
customer_reviews.author: Norman Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Easy
customer_reviews.text: This router was extremely easy to set up! Unplug modem. Attach router. Plug in modem. Plug in router. Search for new connections and enter password (both provided by Netgear - They recommend not changing them. They are unique for every router they ship). The speed wirelessly tested faster than connected straight into the modem. Unbelievable! Pros: The fastest on the market Incredibly easy to set up Cons: No way to obvious way to mount it. It sits on a surface - that's the way it is designed. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: bonnyyew

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but fails at times
customer_reviews.text: There's plenty of chatter on this router - it was touted as one of the best when it was first introduced. There were lots of firmware updates, and in the end there's still connection issues on the 2.4GHz band. My 5GHz devices don't seem to have a problem, but every so often, my laptop or ROKU box will claim that there's no internet because the router has gone offline. It seems to recover within a minute or so, but it's an annoyance. Before you buy this device, be sure that you will maximize its use in the 5GHz band.
customer_reviews.author: R. King

customer_reviews.title: This is the best! If you want speed and reliability, then buy this router.
customer_reviews.text: This router is best. It works very well. This router increases your internet speed and network speed. This router allows you to transfer files back and fourth from PC to PC, Surfing the net and going on Skype all at the same time on different PC's with out the router seizing up. I never had to reset this router, no troubles so far. This router picked up all my WI-FI devices, including my printer. Buy this router if you want the best and if you want to be ready for devices running on the 802.11ac standard.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Rozenberg

customer_reviews.title: Was hoping to be blow away, but wasn't
customer_reviews.text: I had connection and range issues with my previous WiFi router and hoped this would address both (and maybe give me faster speeds). While overall it works well and has extended range, for some reason on my Macbook every time I open it, I have to wait about 15 seconds before it will connect to the internet. With my old router it took maybe a couple of seconds. Also, for Netflix streaming I hoped this would eliminate some connection and speed issues I was having, but it hasn't seemed to. To be fair, the issue could be with my streaming Blu-ray player and not the router.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have to trubleshoot connection 2-3 times a day
customer_reviews.text: I am losing my internet connection 2-3 a day with this router.... "adapter disabled".... I have created an account for the netgear forum to see if someone has any ideas on what the issue might be.... if I cannot find a solution soon, without having to pay for premium support, the router is going back in the box and returned to amazon p.s. I am not impressed with the range and I'm not so sure that I wasn't getting better range with my old netgear router.
customer_reviews.author: Evey Sauntering

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my 10 year old router
customer_reviews.text: Connection to the unit was quick and basically automatic. I connected all of my cables including the hardwired devices as most of my house is ward wired except for our iPhone's and laptop (the TV's etc. are all hardwired CAT 5) I could not get the start up to work on my desktop but it worked just fine from the iPhone after downloading the app. Just click and it connects the router to my cable modem.That's it. I have my 1.5 Terabit Seagate external drive connected to the USB port on the router but have not had the time to play with it much yet.
customer_reviews.author: David Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Sorry but this router is super slow
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but complaints from my family after setting up the wifi, everything connects but the complaints are of slowwwwness. I even have my mac hooked up via LAN and it is so much slower than my previous D-link router. The devices report the correct speeds but I think it doesn't route properly. I had to replace the old d-elink because it wasn't dual band. this is the slap in the face I get for being an early adopter. Every website stalls, this was never the case on my old router.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, go with a cheaper model this is not worth the extra cash.
customer_reviews.text: As a long time user and fan of Netgear products I am hugely disappointed with this device, so much so that I would return it had I not thrown away all the packaging. I had a WNR2000 router at my home but was having frequent range issues within the house so I decided to fix that by buying the Netgear router with the best range I could find and if you look at the packaging from Netgear R6300 should have at least double the range, it doesn’t its marginally if any better so now I have the same problem as before but am out $200. I think it’s time to try out a competitor product 
customer_reviews.author: S. Sigurdsson

customer_reviews.title: Much faster than old wired router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I finally needed wifi in my house for our new smartphones. Our house is completely wired with category 5 so we had no wifi in the house until now. This router is clearly faster than my old wired router so that is a bonus right there. As far as wifi is concerned, it is twice as fast as my friend's relatively new router. Unfortunately I have to have this tucked deep in my basement so I only get fair and some poor wifi signals at some parts of my house so I will probably use one of my wires and buy a second one as a wired repeater for my 2nd floor.
customer_reviews.author: A. Begun

customer_reviews.title: BIG improvement
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced a Linksys router I had used for three years and has proven to be a HUGE step up. This Netgear unit has the most recent versions of wireless technology - which is most noticeable through its extended range and ability to penetrate three floors and five intermediate walls and still deliver a crisp, dependable signal to a laptop attached to the treadmill in the attic. Since installing this unit, the lost signals and dropped connections I used to fight have disappeared. Installation was a breeze, the manual was very well written, specific and helpful, and the operation since has been nearly flawless. You are going to be very happy you bought this router.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Welch

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: By far this is the best router I have came across. I purchased a $250 Linksys router about 6 months ago, but I have to reboot it every 3 weeks to a month to get it to working right. With this Net-Gear gigabit wireless router, I haven't messed with it at all, it works like a charm right out of the box. Wireless transfer rate was lightning fast, I connected at least 10 devices wirelessly to this device and they all have lightning speed download/upload. Added with a 50 MB/s high speed internet connection, you are good to go. Genie software is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas, TX

customer_reviews.title: Don't mess with a good thing
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviewers of this product have had problems with installation. I had none. Simply follow the instructions. It came right up, all devices connected easily when attempted. I did experience one problem with the router disconnecting. However, I had left the router this one replaced right next to it and broadcasting. Once it was shut down disconnecting ceased. Netgear Genie now provides me with many of the features I had to kluge through various pieces of software in an easy to navigate interface. I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Howell

customer_reviews.title: Great Router with a great Range, Speed and a nice look
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router for use in our apartment to connect TV, Xbox to it via cable and so the classy black look of the router itself makes it nicely presentable next to the TV. The wireless is very strong and fast and can be configured individually on 2.4 and 5 GHz frequency for different speed mobile devices. Setup is very quick and easy for getting the device up and running, but also very detailed if one wants to set up more refined settings, such as guest WiFi, permissions and other features. It also spots USB ports to share your printer or external hard drive via network to your devices.
customer_reviews.author: Philip R

customer_reviews.title: Triple "A" Router
customer_reviews.text: This is a high speed broadband router which works seamlessly with my system. I bought this router about 6 months ago to replace one that was not strong enough to carry the Wi-Fi signal across the entire length of my house. This one carries it 60+ feet to the main viewing screen then, with the Netgear Wi-Fi Range Extender, the signal is carried across another 20 feet to another monitor. Delicious! Only once have I had to reboot the signal for one of the components which fixed the problem immediately. This was easy to install, is simple to maintain and a success at its job. Top dollar and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Liz@nola

customer_reviews.title: Another unit that would not work
customer_reviews.text: This product would not work out of the box. I spent more than an hour with Netgear support but they could not get the unit to work. It showed power, connection to the modem but after trying every possible option none of my computers or devices (Mac, PC, iPad, iPhone) could detect the device. Looking at other reviews this seems too common a problem. I cannot recommend anyone buy from Netgear if its QC is so bad they are sending out numerous units which do not work out of the box. I've been using a Cisco system which has been flawless and this experience really turns me off to Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Silver Ecowarrior

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR Wireless Router - AC 1750 Dual Band Gigabit (R6300)
customer_reviews.text: It is awesome: very fast, very good wireless connection (beam forming, doubtlessly), with on/off Wi-Fi switch so I don't have to bathe in Wi-Fi radiation when using my Ethernet-wired desktop computers. Set-up was very easy following enclosed quick-start guide, I did it from a wired connection to be on the safe side. Once I had Internet access for the wired computer, I turned on the Wi-Fi and entered my passphrase into each of the 4 mobile devices that I wanted on my home network, and they all connected flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Range, Easy Install and Helpful Features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to finally upgrade my home network to 802.11N and decided the 802.11ac might just help me keep ahead of the game. I'm still looking forward to updating the rest of my network, but for now the "N" is awesome. This router handles multiple devices simultaneously with ease, and the Netgear Genie software made it easy to install and manage. We use the DLNA media server to share home and ripped videos, and the Ready Share feature works great with an external hard drive (so my PC doesn't have to stay on all the time).
customer_reviews.author: K. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Very good router for small office or home
customer_reviews.text: the 5ghz works great. The 2.4 works good for my wireless camera's. The one draw back is cannot filer by mac address. But has intergrated opendns and blocked websites good features. The 1GIG NIC is great. I use alot of internal networking file transfers handles perfect, had some friends of mine from the army try to hack the system, took them 12 hours to get into the 2.4ghz wirless, the most easy part to get into. But system locked it out after noticed intrustion
customer_reviews.author: William Woesner

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: Painless to setup, just works, love the "guest network" capability. Been using it for over a month with no issues. Previous router of about three years was a Netgear WNDR3400. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is it is going to be some time before we know for sure how well/easy this thing works with final specification 802.11ac adapters, so a 5 star review would be premature. Clearly part of the reason to spend this much money on a router is the "future proofing" aspect, and that remains to be seen how well it will work out.
customer_reviews.author: G. Rule

customer_reviews.title: Everything Works
customer_reviews.text: I have twice the bandwidth as my previous router and now it's even faster as well. I'm regularly getting the same speed out of my wireless router as I do directly from the modem. Set up was plug and play (so, I don't see where people are having issues). I plugged it in, followed the prompts on the monitor and in about 10 minutes I was up and running. To avoid having to re-enlist all my devices, I gave the new router the same name and passwords (normal and guest) as the old one. Everything works!
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic router
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the latest technology I could find. The 802.11ac was not even known by my local office stores. They claimed the 802.11n was the latest router technology. That is how new it was! I looked on line and even called several places. The netgear was very easy to set up! The step by step instructions made it a piece of cake to follow along. It costs a little more than the "n" routers, but the dual band "ac" routers will take you into the future. I am very pleased with the purchase, and Amazon beat everybody's price!
customer_reviews.author: papashey

customer_reviews.title: Can't hold a simple connection
customer_reviews.text: Unit comes with nice utilities. Good thing because you'll need them. Setup was simple but intermittently drops connection and sometimes reconnects automatically, sometimes not. This is a real pain and makes the experience unpleasant. After about two weeks I returned for a different Mfr with USB 3.0 port and very few drops if any mentioned by reviewers. I like the fact that Linksys monitors feedback and responds with help that may solve a problem so I went with a Linksys EA6700.
customer_reviews.author: JDLOWELL

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Cisco E2500 that died after it automatically updated its firmware. I had always used Lynksys so I was apprehensive about buying a Netgear router. No worries! So easy to set up and much easier to access than the Cisco unit. Coverage in my two story home is much better as well. Speeds are awesome and downloads are much faster. Well worth the money compared to all the other routers I've had or worked with. As long as it keeps performing! If not I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Terwillager

customer_reviews.title: It was good while it lasted... consider extedned warranty of some sort to go with it or risk having a brick on your hands
customer_reviews.text: The router worked well for 1 year and 5 months. Wi-fi started dropping out more and more frequently afterwards. My attempts to revive it by resetting to factory config and reflashing the firmware were not successful: wired connections appear ok, wireless so unstable that the router is unusable. I expected a longer run out of this pricey gadget based on my previous experience with Netgear. Fortunately I still had an old WGR614 in the garage. I dusted it off and am running it now. I am back in the market for an 'ac' router; will look at Netgear's competitors this time.
customer_reviews.author: FT

customer_reviews.title: Used now for over a year......
customer_reviews.text: I'm finally reviewing this wireless router. I thought the price was high when I purchased it BUT liked the feedback and wanted something 'easy' and reliable. The price has dropped (I paid $200) and it has been worth what I paid for it. It's been effortless and hasn't given me any problems. Hopefully; it'll last at least five full years........? My previous router (DLINK) lasted six years...... I also see there is now a newer model out........(of course). Recommended. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Marie

customer_reviews.title: Not much wifi distance
customer_reviews.text: When my other router died, I bought what I thought would be the best there is. The four either net connections work very well. The WIFI on the other hand does not have a great amount of distance. I had to get two wifi extenders and place them in strategic locations around my house. I still have dead spots. Having said that, I have a three story house and the electronic closet is on the front middle level. I placed the wifi extenders on the first and third floors. Overall it is a nice router.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Worked great - when it worked.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install, looked great and had great range. Unfortunately on one of my laptops, I had periodic dropouts where it just wouldn't work and then after a few minutes it would come back. Talked to ISP provider, laptop provider and Netgear. Everybody said it was someone else. Spent a LOT of time trying to fix issue. Replaced the leptop. New one (different model) did same thing. Replaced router with old version and problem gone. Replaced this model with a Netgear 750 and it works great. Must have been a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: N. Baer

customer_reviews.title: Rate it 4 so far but close to 5
customer_reviews.text: I did read some reviews and was concerned about set up. Not to worry. It's a snap. Easy and intuitive. I was concerned as well about the range as my previous router was limited in the farthest bedroom in our home. Again, not a problem. We have 2 laptops minimally and when our children are home up to 5. 2 iPads and again more. And Sonos wireless music system. It handles it all. I've not streamed any movies yet so that's the reason for the 4 stars. May update later, but it's worth the money as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: M. Beran

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good about this router. The range is incredible as it covers my entire 1 acre homesite from inside my office. Also, it saved me having to buy a new wireless printer as it connects easily to the router and works very well. It was easy to set up & allows for lots of individual preferences. I also love the "guest" mode for people that stay at my house, not having to give them my private password and I like the ability to use a different frequency also, if necessary. I really like & suggest this product.
customer_reviews.author: Len Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Firmware Corruption Warning
customer_reviews.text: Beware! When it works, it works great.....but don't you dare lose power or even look at it sideways....firmware will go corrupt in a heartbeat. First time I was able to fix it through the wired update of the firmware { [...] } in case you need it. Second time however it turned into a brick (and yes 30-30-30 "fix" for reset to factory default did not work either).....so here I am. Looking at if I should dump another $200 into the Netgear pocket of poor quality or rip up my entire home network at ~$500 cost and go with Cisco or D-Link....Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: delijack

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and fast!
customer_reviews.text: I own a Buffalo Tech AirStation HighPower N300 Wireless Router, and was constantly having issues with video streaming speed and range. Tried several range extenders but still... service was spotty. Decided to try this router and, although none of my current devices support the AC standard, the dual band + dual frequency has really made a difference. I can now reach all corners of my house with a signal strong enough to stream Netflix anywhere in the house....and the user interface is also very simple. Didn't try the Buffalo Tech AC router, because this one had better speed test results online and also had more (and better) user reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Love this router!
customer_reviews.text: Short review since I'm not high-tech. I've had very poor success with routers in the past. I have had difficulty with installation and dead spots in my three story home since my computer is upstairs and my TV is downstairs. Installation of this router was a breeze, the smart phone app is very slick and helpful and the signal is very strong. I have been using this router for a few months and I could not be happier with this purchase. Recommended with enthusiasm!
customer_reviews.author: JWH

customer_reviews.title: Best router ever
customer_reviews.text: Had a TP Link that required a cold reboot at least twice a week. I read cnet reviews and saw the high rating this router was given and took the chance on it. Since the very easy install I have enjoyed much quicker Internet access and a much stronger signal all around my house and patio. Also, I have had no need to reboot this unit as I always had to with the TP Link I threw away. It was a bit pricier than other brands but I feel it delivers on quality and value and is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Austin T. Bechtold

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working quite well
customer_reviews.text: VERY easy to set up. My old router was about 6 years old so we were ready for a new one. The speed is terrific and so far is handling all of our gadgets - including multiple smart TVs, phones, gaming, computers, tablets, etc. Range was also extended greatly in our house although I think I will still get a Netgear extender. I just don't need to run out to get one as quickly as I had planned to. All in all, I am quite pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Quirk

customer_reviews.title: Awesome performance!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased w/this router right out of the box. I put it in the most remote corner of the house and powered it up. I went to the far opposite corner of the house (4-5 walls away), and I still got 100% signal strength measurements on my phone and my laptop. The older Netgear it replaced typically had about 30% strength. I don't have the latest adaptors, so I'm not using all the bandwidth capabilities of this device yet, but just the signal strength, range, and stability make this a very worthwhile purchase!
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Easy Setup, Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone has said...SUPER easy setup. Made sure to upgrade the firmware before doing anything else. Was able to make changes instantly, easily. Wireless Printer, network of computers (Macs and PCs), Apple TV, XBOX 360, AT&T Mobile Cell, and several mobile devices instantly loved the new wifi with no issues. Not to mention, I picked up some serious speed and stability in my network...and the range is incredible. Really happy thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks. We were having some problems with a different router for multiple devices and decided to pony up for this router. This thing is lightning fast. I have been streaming an HD movie, listening to streaming music and surfing the web on 4 devices all at the same time with no decrease in connectivity speeds. If you are in the market for a lightning fast wireless router, this is the one for you. It is pricey, but if you hate slow internet, it's worth it
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Had no problems configuring any of the devices attached to it. Some nice features built into the router software. The only downside for me is I could not install it in my cable management cabinet. Operational indicators are on the front, certain control buttons on the right side, and plugs in the back facing directly out from the back, it could not be installed inside the cabinet. No problems since there's room elsewhere in the cable room.
customer_reviews.author: gunmahoro

customer_reviews.title: Tried and true
customer_reviews.text: Used for a year now. Very fast. Good wifi around the home: Desktop, laptops, iPhone, TV, Alexa, Ecobee, Rumba, Hue, everything funning thru it but the cats.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Lankton

customer_reviews.title: Finally we have wifi all over the house!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first router, and I've tried 5 or 6 less expensive models of various brands, that transmits reliable quality wifi throughout my 1928 tudor cottage. Although the house is only 1750 square feet, the solid wood walls gave other models trouble even in the next room. It even works in the garage apartment where my daughter lives! Don't waste your money on cheaper models if you need a router to generate wifi in a large area.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Harris

customer_reviews.title: impressed
customer_reviews.text: -supports many devices including video streaming at once -3 floors (located on the mid level)of an older house -small house but probably contains some lead paint beneath the many layers -slows when the modem is used directly (bypassing this router)- noticable impact -slows during peak internet provider demand time- minimal We have Clear as our provider and during peak tower demand we have, in the past, given up trying use a lot of internet services. This router has powered us through these times, saving us from expensive internet service.
customer_reviews.author: SKS

customer_reviews.title: Great product --- while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Great product --- while it lasted. Easy set up, great performance. But, at 14 months, it all but stopped working. When I could get it to run, it was slower than dial-up in the '90s. Three multi-hour sessions with the company could not fix the problem. (The service was not free, but I did get my money back on the service calls.)
customer_reviews.author: sashamanda

customer_reviews.title: So Far seems very good
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this router after reading reviews here and on Cnet. My prior router was a Netgear N600 and I had a lot of issues with signal strenght, even in a small apartment... So far, range has been great, even with thick Brazilian walls, and speed has increased substantially from my previous router, let's see how good it is with time... UPDATE 05/2013 - Been using for quite a long time and not problems so far. Range and speed are the best I found in a home device.
customer_reviews.author: Luiz Salomao

customer_reviews.title: This router is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: We were having problems with our 4 yr old router. It still worked but after researching I found that because we have the newer technolgy in phones, printers and having a kindle that it just could not handle those types of connections. Our wireless was so week that soon became no connection at all. I purchased this router and wow....full wireless bars on all equipment. You will not be dissapointed in this router.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Substantial coverage improvement
customer_reviews.text: Before I switched out to the Netgear router, I walked around my house and yard with the wifi tester on my Android tablet. After installing the Netgear unit, I did the same thing. I saw a 10-20% improvement in signal strength everywhere. Now, I have wifi coverage throughout my house and even to the furthest corners of my yard. And all that time I was going to spend setting up multiple access points was spent streaming TV in the backyard. Kudos, Netgear!
customer_reviews.author: Zaggie

customer_reviews.title: Not as I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I had an ASUS RT-AC66U Router for about a year but suddenly it stopped working. Since I did not want that to happen again, I thought I go this time for a Netgear. After reading all online reviews I decided to go with the Netgear R6300 router, compared to the ASUS it is too slow and the range is far smaller. I decided to go back to the ASUS router after all but this time I bought a 2 year protection plan for it.
customer_reviews.author: Abarmard

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ROUTER - TERRIBLE SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: LIKES: Great speed and range. DISLIKES: 1)Must install print server software to run in background on EACH computer on network to use non-wireless printer. 2)90-day free support is TOTALLY USELESS - by phone, email and video's! Outsourced support center could NOT explain how to set up router as DLNA media server. Website videos refer to different router. BOTTOM LINE: Not worth the hassle to exchange but would NOT buy NETGEAR again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: EXTREME
customer_reviews.text: HEY, REPLACED MY 8 YEAR OLD MODEM AND ROUTER (NETGEAR) WITH A NEW MODEM AND ROUTER (NETGEAR R6300v2). WHAT A "NO BRAINER". SIMPLY FOLLOWED THE QUICK START STUFF. WHAT SCARED ME WAS THE SHUT DOWN AND START UP AS ALL COMMUNICATION IS LOST. I WAS ON THE PHONE WITH MY INTERNET PROVIDER SWITCHING OVER. WAS TOLD TO DISCONNECT THE OLD SYSTEM WHILE NEW SYSTEM DATA WAS BEING INPUT. BAM. NO PHONE. NO INTERNET. NO COMMUNICATION. NO PROBLEM. FIRED UP THE NEW SYSTEM. BAM. ALL WAS WAY ABOVE NORMAL. NO GLITCHES. NEW EXTREME SPEEDS. LIKE EVERYTHING IS A LITTLE BRITER. THANKS NETGEAR. THIS IS MY 3RD ROUTER FROM YOU. TRUST IS A GREAT THING!
customer_reviews.author: DOUGNLEN

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic (at first)!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best router I've ever had when I first got it, that was 30 days ago. Out of the blue it just decided to quit I haven't been able to reboot or make any sort of changes, reset, nada. Hopefully the exchange process works well, I'm already out postage so there goes any savings buying it on the web! When the hole process is over I'm sure I'll revisit this review.
customer_reviews.author: What Meow?

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Looks Cool
customer_reviews.text: Was having trouble picking up my network in the far rooms of the house. My wireless router was approaching 10 years old so I figured why not see what a new piece of equipment would do. Problem solved! Easy to set up and has been performing flawlessly for several weeks now. Some reviews mention the size as a negative but I like the look. It has to sit in the open so, for me, the glossy black, no antenna look is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: tsihq

customer_reviews.title: Solved all of my connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: High priced but absolutely worth it - I bought another less expensive brand and three or four devices just couldn't stay consistently connected; the other router also needed to be rebooted daily. A friend recommended this one. I installed this in 1 minute, configured in 2 minutes and reconnected all devices throughout the house - voila! It's been about three months and I haven't rebooted once; all devices play happily with it and each other, including wireless printer.
customer_reviews.author: JB Haller

customer_reviews.title: If you prefer ethernet to wireless...
customer_reviews.text: We all make mistakes; perhaps Netgear doesn't consider this product bearing their name a mistake but I consider my purchase a big mistake. Consistently dropped internet connections every 30 to 90 seconds. The only way it would stay dependably connected was by an ethernet cable. Five calls to "Gearhead tech support" produced 3 fruitless results and two 'dropped' calls. Product returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Morris Alpern

customer_reviews.title: Worst customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Dad and I've set up wireless networks before. This product worked with every device I have EXCEPT his laptop, which was the main reason I bought it. When I filled out the registration it asks if you need help and would like someone to call you and I checked that 3 weeks ago. A couple days after I filled that out I called and got someone's voice-mail. I ended up having to buy a Netgear WiFi USB Adapter for $65.
customer_reviews.author: J. Muir

customer_reviews.title: The Netgear AC 1750 Wireless Router is Super Fast
customer_reviews.text: The AC 1750 is demonstrably faster than previous generation routers! The speed and signal stability exemplifies best in class performance. Unlike many other reviews, I had absolutely no problem configuring the router via my desktop PC. The signal was strong as far away as 50 feet. I even went outside my house and worked by the swimming pool without performance degradation. The only thing I don't like is the gold along the bottom of the router front panel. Considering how sleek the product design is I would have expected a glossy silver to offset the illuminated Netgear logo, which is sorta' cool when trying to find the router in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: David Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Died after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This wireless router started dropping connections and finally totally died. Called Netgear support whichnwas total waste of time. After 35 minutes the Tech gave me a case number and asked that call the next day. She couldn't begin to troubleshoot this device, gave up and basically asked to call back and I could get someone else that might be able to help. Total B.S.
customer_reviews.author: Duffer62

customer_reviews.title: Netgear AC1750 Router (Great)
customer_reviews.text: I got this router because my previous one what hit by lightning. The price I paid was very reasonable. I have always had my eye on this particular model. It has the features and speed I have always wanted and or needed. The one thing about this kind of router and other models like it, is that from time to time you need to reboot it on a frequent basis. Overall an excellent purchase for any family.
customer_reviews.author: Russell A. StarnerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router
customer_reviews.text: Super fast, super reliable, super configurable. With this router you are well positioned for the future. It is currently supporting a home network with over 25 devices. The simultaneous 5g band gives the ones that can support it, a separate high-speed highway of communication leaving the 2.4ghz band for everything else. The router comes packaged very professionally, has excellent documentation online and a great web interface. I highly recommend this router. The speed is unbelievable. I've owned it for 2 months and have not had a reason yet to reset it- that's reliability! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S.

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks
customer_reviews.text: I had an old faithful Linksys WRT54G for many years but it was starting to hit performance issues mainly because of interference with the baby monitor operating on the same 2.4GHz frequency. I went from 5-8Mbps to 29Mbps immediately after I set up the R6300, for the devices that could work on 5GHz. This router is ultra fast! I also like the secured guest network feature.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: 2nd One Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I received the first on on 30 Jan 13 and it work great for a couple of hours. The WiFi decided to stop working but the wired connections were still up. On 31 Jan 13 told Amazon and they shipped out a replacement the same day. Hooked up the second on on 2 Feb 13 and it is trucking along just fine. I'm also using a WN3000RP to extend the R6300 with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: R. Arevalo

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Firmware is corrupted easily (just by powering off and on). About 6 months ago I spent an hour on the phone with Netgear support getting it to work again. They told me if it happens again, I would have to pay for help. Last week it happened again. I decided to purchase a new router. For $200 this shouldn't be happening.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Significant upgrade over D-Link DIR-655
customer_reviews.text: I have been extremely satisfied with the AC 1750 since I installed it 2 months ago. I replaced a D-Link DIR-655 and I am surprised at the extent of the upgrade. The speed is noticeably quicker, the range is significantly better, and the reliability has been flawless. With the DIR-655, I had reverted to Powerline adapters for my Direct TV internet connection but now I am able to connect via wifi to the AC 1750 and the speed is sufficient to watch programs immediately after initiating the download. The router set up was very straightforward and the management console software is easy to use and feature rich.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Betts

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Great software. This is super easy to install and use. The sodtware package gives great control over the network and has mobile apps (I haven't tried thisbwith my droid yet) It also allows you to print wirelessly from your regular non wireless enabled printer. I'm working with a Mac based system. It has a system map that allows you to see what is connected to the Network.
customer_reviews.author: Homer's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent admin GUI and ease of set-up!
customer_reviews.text: As a family, we have an ever-increasing number of wireless gadgets and decided to upgrade from our old dependable D-link. After doing some quick online research, Netgear came out on top as THE router manufacturer right now. We are about 3 days in with the router and so far, 100% uptime. I can't stress the importance of a usable admin interface after struggling with some truly awful interfaces in the past, and the R6300 is well laid out, fairly sensical and works well.
customer_reviews.author: T. Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: This is the router you need
customer_reviews.text: I have a large 2 story house and have always had wifi coverage issues, I've been through at least 4 different routers and my cable guy finally recommended this unit as the ultimate and he was right. Going on 3 months now, no connectivity issues anywhere in the house. We have 3 desktops, 3 laptops, 2 iPads and multiple smartphones working all the time. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bend Slick

customer_reviews.title: dont buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router, supposedly the best available for 200 bux. After a month the firmware got corrupted. No problem,....free 90 tech support only took 2 hours with a very nice gentleman from Asia. So I figure I am all good, then not a MONTH LATER it has happened again. Now more time on the phone if I still have free support. I will probably have to pay. My last router lasted 3 years with no problems and it was 50 bux....Argh. This sux!
customer_reviews.author: Donny Wilson

customer_reviews.title: r6300v2
customer_reviews.text: The Netgear Router AC1750 (R6300) is the version 2 and it is great. Super fast that covers my whole home and definitely an upgrade from the Netgear N655 that I was using. No more dropped connections. Our home is approx 4500 sq feet and we run all of our wireless products including televisions, ipads, iphones, laptops, desktops etc concurrently without problems.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great router, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This router has great range and was easy to set up. Made it simple and easy with netgear genie to run multiple wireless networks. I put my bandwidth hogging devices on 5GHz network and my normal stuff (and 2.4GHz only equipment) on my 2.4GHz network. Super easy to manage connections and when power goes out it comes right back on without a hitch. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: stephen sikorski

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for several years and it works great! Provides Wi-Fi throughout my 1500 sq ft home without issue. Works as good as the day I bought it. No problems here. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly JMac

customer_reviews.title: Slow slow slow
customer_reviews.text: purchased and this must have had an issue. 4x slower than the Netgear 900 I have. Did the speed test on this device and it came up with .51KPS switched to my other router and it was 2mps... hmmmm returned it. had to have an issue
customer_reviews.author: Jace H. Dees

customer_reviews.title: This router is a total failure
customer_reviews.text: Unit worked ok for 2 months. Then started exhibiting "corrupt firmware" syndrome. I contacted Netgear customer service, reloaded (more than once) the current firmware. Returned the unit to Netgear, received a new one. Same failures right out of the box. I've wasted too many hours on this thing. I'm pitching it in the trash bin. Total failure to perform.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Firmware Corrupted
customer_reviews.text: The router itself is very stylish and has Apple-like simplicity in its design. That is about all I can say about the router because it would not connect to the internet. The green power light kept flashing and apparently this means the firmware is corrupted. The router itself would not even reset when I pressed the power button. Bought this as a gift and was very disappointed. I have an Airport Extreme that works great but thought Id give this router a try since it is 802.11 ac future proof. You let me down netgear :(
customer_reviews.author: macattack71189

customer_reviews.title: Best Router I've Ever Owned!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very technically inclined but I can say that I love this product so far. The guy at Charter Communications that I spoke with on the phone when setting up an appointment to have Charter come out to my new apartment told me that this is "One fine piece of equipment" and that I would not regret ordering it. Great speed and so far I haven't lost any connection. All my wireless devices connected without any issue.
customer_reviews.author: Martin1290

customer_reviews.title: Had this router a few months now
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router! We have five people and many devices in our house - five laptops, four PCs, two servers, multiple game consoles, TVs,, phones etc, and have never encountered bandwidth problems. I saw it streaming three Netflix HD streams and two FPS games wirelessly at the same time with no lag or video quality issues. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router
customer_reviews.text: I had a NETGEAR router (3600) that was 3 years old, that was very slow and dropping out, which meant I had to reset the modem and router often. I replaced my router with R6300 dualband and all my issues went away. I also had my cable company replace the their modem which also improve the total system, however saw the biggest changes to the download speed with the new router.
customer_reviews.author: WFMi

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Wireless Router – AC1750 Dual Band Gigabit (R6300)
product_meta.description:
The Netgear R6300 WiFi Router gives you next generation WiFi at Gigabit speeds making it ideal for serious gamers and for people wanting high-speed access at home. The dual band Gigabit router enables HD streaming throughout your home with speeds up to 3 X faster than Wireless-N. The Netgear Gigabit router is compatible with next generation WiFi devices and backward compatible with 802.11n. The Netgear R6300 WiFi Router is not only one of the fastest routers on the market it is also incredibly easy to install and set-up. The Netgear Genie App provides a valuable personal dashboard enabling you to monitor and manage your network.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Industry's first and fastest 802.11ac wireless router with speeds up to 1750 Mbps
Simultaneous Dual Band - Doubles bandwidth and reduce WiFi interference for better connections
NETGEAR Genie App - Easy-to-use dashboard to monitor, control & repair home networks
Wireless security with the highest grade protection
Compatible with next generation WiFi devices and backward compatible with 802.11n

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,231 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
